pullRequest.title: Removed admin monitor related to ZFS
pullRequest.bodyText:
This now just removes the libzfs library and the two things using it:

ZFSInstaller, an admin monitor, likely not tested for years. If there is some point to this, better to resurrect as a plugin (and support on Linux ZFS too). AFAICT this was an old attempt by KK to improve the OOTB experience for novice admins installing Hudson on Solaris, that presumably does not match how Jenkins is managed today by the small number of Illumos users.
ZFSProvisioner, literally unused and so also deleted in #5048.

Proposed changelog entries

Removed administrative monitor offering to migrate $JENKINS_HOME on a ZFS filesystem.

Maintainer checklist
Before the changes are marked as ready-for-merge:

 There are at least 2 approvals for the pull request and no outstanding requests for change
 Conversations in the pull request are over OR it is explicit that a reviewer does not block the change
 Changelog entries in the PR title and/or Proposed changelog entries are correct
 Proper changelog labels are set so that the changelog can be generated automatically
 If the change needs additional upgrade steps from users, upgrade-guide-needed label is set and there is a Proposed upgrade guidelines section in the PR title. (example)
 If it would make sense to backport the change to LTS, a Jira issue must exist, be a Bug or Improvement, and be labeled as lts-candidate to be considered (see query).

nodes.bodyText: Used by https://github.com/jenkinsci/extras-ec2-launcher/blob/573b09eb9586e539dc30c8596e4886d167877b8e/src/main/resources/org/jvnet/hudson/ec2/launcher/smf.xml which I presume is also long obsolete.

nodes.bodyText: Note that as in #5048, this is not just unused but unusable.

commit.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins into solaris
Restore Solaris-specific functionality other than libzfs
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins into solaris
